title: Ethereum Whales Are Buying These 3 Cryptocurrencies Hand Over Fist - The Motley Fool
summary: Ethereum whales are investing heavily in three cryptocurrencies: USD Coin, Tether, and Chiliz. USD Coin is the top choice, followed by Tether and Chiliz. While these cryptocurrencies are popular among whales, they may not be the best picks for non-whales due to their lack of upside potential. Stablecoins like USD Coin and Tether offer stability but limited growth, while Chiliz is exclusive to the Socios.com sports platform, making it more appealing to sports fans.

title: Polygon (MATIC) and Optimism (OP): Which Technology Is More Beneficial for Ethereum (ETH)? - U.Today
summary: Polygon (MATIC) and Optimism (OP) are two Layer 2 scaling solutions aiming to improve Ethereum's (ETH) scalability. Polygon uses zk-SNARKs-based ZK-Rollups to group transactions, while Optimism uses a leader-based mechanism called Optimistic Rollups. Ethereum co-creator Vitalik Buterin believes that second-layer ZK-Rollups will ultimately surpass Optimistic Rollups as the preferred scalability solution for Ethereum. While Optimistic solution is currently more advanced, ZK-Rollups are faster and could lead to increased adoption.

title: ETH to peak at $2,474 in 2023 According to Finder’s Ethereum Price Predictions Report - Blockchain News
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in under 256 tokens:

Ethereum is expected to reach $2,474 in 2023, according to Finder's panel of experts. Digital Capital Management's managing director predicts $2,500 by year-end, while Seasonal Tokens creator expects $3,000. However, some experts predict lower prices, with Associate Professor of Decentralised Finance forecasting $1,000 by end of 2023 and $2,000 by 2025. Ethereum's price is currently $1,588. Most panelists think ETH is underpriced, and nearly half expect it to eventually surpass Bitcoin as the largest cryptocurrency by market cap. Long-term predictions include $6,033 by 2025 and $14,316 by 2030, according to the panel average.

title: Premier League gets Ethereum-based digital cards with Sorare partnership - Cointelegraph
summary: Sorare, a blockchain-powered fantasy sports platform, has partnered with the English Premier League to create Ethereum-based digital player cards. The deal is reportedly worth $100 million and will see Sorare mint digital cards of Premier League players, which fans can collect, trade, and use to play on the platform's fantasy sports league. The partnership is expected to last four years and will see Sorare make an upfront payment to the league for licensing rights, with a percentage of digital card sales going to the Premier League. This partnership is the latest example of how blockchain technology is being used to connect fans, players, and organizations in the sports industry.

title: Social Token Project Rally Shuts Ethereum Sidechain, Stranding Users’ Crypto Assets - CoinDesk
summary: Social token project Rally has shut down its Ethereum sidechain, stranding users' crypto assets. NFTs on the sidechain are not transferable to mainnet, leaving them inaccessible after the site shuts down on Tuesday. Users will no longer be able to access their assets.

title: Bitcoin 7-month high 'dominance' has BTC price eyeing $25K — Will Ethereum spoil the rally? - Cointelegraph
summary: Bitcoin's 7-month high in dominance has BTC price eyeing $25K, with the index potentially rising further due to technical indicators and market sentiment. However, Ethereum's potential bullish reversal could reduce Bitcoin's dominance, with the ETH/BTC pair consolidating near its support area and potentially rebounding towards its descending trendline resistance. The article does not contain investment advice or recommendations, and readers are advised to conduct their own research before making any investment or trading decisions.

title: Shiba Inu (SHIB) Lead Dev's Ethereum (ETH) Domain Name for Sale, Here's for How Much - U.Today
summary: Shytoshi Kusama, lead developer of Shiba Inu (SHIB), has put up his Ethereum (ETH) domain name, Shytoshi.eth, for sale on OpenSea for 500 ETH (around $790,000). The seller hopes that Kusama will buy it before an Ethereum whale does, and plans to use the money to buy BONE tokens. This comes after BoneShibaSwap, the official account for Shiba Inu, hinted twice that they would like Kusama to buy the domain. The sale will last until April 30, and the seller believes that Kusama is one of the most important people in the crypto world. Meanwhile, Shytoshi Kusama has not responded to the tweets, and there is speculation that an announcement related to Shibarium may be coming soon, as Kusama told the Shiba community on Telegram to "keep popcorn on the ready" over the weekend.

title: BTC vs ETH: Better Buy Between Ethereum and Bitcoin in 2023 - Bankless Times
summary: Bitcoin and Ethereum prices plummeted in 2022 due to soaring interest rates, rising inflation, and the collapse of Terra, Voyager Digital, and FTX. Bitcoin dropped by 65%, while Ethereum crashed by 68%. In 2023, Ethereum faces regulatory risks as it effectively became a security with the merge, and analysts believe that BTC will perform better than ETH due to these risks. However, Ethereum has upgrades planned for Q1 and Q2 of 2023, including the Shanghai upgrade and the introduction of sharding mechanism, which could positively impact its ecosystem.

title: Interest in ENS domain names remains low; the reason is quite surprising - AMBCrypto News
summary: Interest in ENS domain names remains low despite the recent price rally. According to Dune Analytics data, there were only 53,359 Ethereum Name Service (ENS) registrations in 2022, with a steady decline in monthly domain name purchases. Primary ENS name registrations saw a spike in the last month, but overall revenue from name registrations on the platform decreased. The ENS market cap has grown by 46% YTD, and holders are distributing their holdings to realize profits. However, the MVRV ratio is high at 74%, indicating a potential price correction.

title: Wormhole Set To Become Uniswap’s Official Bridge To BNB Chain - Ethereum World News
summary: Wormhole has been chosen as Uniswap's official bridge to BNB Chain after winning a governance vote. The bridge beat other contenders LayerZero and deBridge with more than 62% of the votes. Uniswap aims to deploy on other chains before its BUSL license expires in April, and community members believe that BNB Chain's strong governance model and active community could provide valuable support and feedback for the development of Uniswap V3. Wormhole will now need to pass a final governance vote to secure its status as the official bridge to BNB Chain.

title: 'Gala Dinner' With Trump Now For 1 ETH As Sweepstake NFT Floor Price Plunges By 94% - Benzinga
summary: The floor price of Donald Trump Winner Sweepstakes NFT has plummeted by 94% since its first sale on Jan. 12, now valued at 0.122 Ethereum (worth $192). The price of a Gala dinner NFT has dropped to 1 ETH ($1577), down 65% from last month. Despite this, the best offer to buy stands at $0.0751 ETH. The total volume of NFTs sold is 229 ETH with 821 owners, including 29% unique owners. Trump unveiled Collect Trump Cards in December, selling 45,000 NFTs for $4.45 million within a day. Individual NFTs have fetched higher prices due to demand, despite the recent price drop.

title: English Premier League partners with this blockchain fantasy sports platform to mint Ethereum-based digital player cards - Cryptopolitan
summary:
Sure! Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Sorare, a blockchain-powered fantasy sports platform, has partnered with the English Premier League (EPL) to create Ethereum-based digital player cards. Fans can mint, collect, and trade virtual player cards, with a portion of profits going to the league. Sorare uses ERC-721 token standard for NFT player cards, allowing fans to collect and trade these tokens in the fantasy sports league. This innovative technology links users with their favorite teams and clubs, and Sorare is excited to see it creating the next generation of sports fanatics and entertainment experiences.

title: Crypto Token standards explained: ERC20, BEP20, BEP2, ERC721, ERC1155, ERC4626, ERC777, Wrapped tokens - Cryptopolitan
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in 256 words or less:

Crypto token standards are protocols that govern how blockchain tokens function. Popular standards include ERC20, BEP20, ERC721, ERC1155, and ERC4626. These standards provide a framework for token creation, transfer, and management, ensuring interoperability and security. Token standards are essential for the success of blockchain technology, as they allow for greater flexibility and compatibility between different blockchain networks. Examples of tokens that use these standards include Uniswap, Chainlink, and Bancor.

title: Bitcoin at $23.4k; Solana, Ethereum also witness minor dips - APN Live

Bitcoin price surges to $23.4k, while Solana and Ethereum witness minor dips. In the world of football, Chelsea has acquired several talented players, but some have failed to live up to expectations. Here are three players who did not perform well during their time at Chelsea:

1. Alvaro Morata - Arrived from Real Madrid with high confidence, but his performances nose-dived after a bright start. He scored 15 goals in 30 starts, but only had five goals in his second season before being loaned out to Atletico Madrid.
2. Khalid Boulahrouz - Struggled to adapt to the English Premier League and Chelsea's tactical demands. He made six appearances and scored no goals during his loan spell at Sevilla.
3. Winston Bogarde - Despite his experience playing for popular clubs, he failed to make an impact at Chelsea. He made nine appearances, scored no goals, and gave no assists before being dismissed from the team in 2006.
